SOURCE

This notebook is an extract of the source notebook linked above + a minor formatting change.

To be able to successfully convert models trained using fastai to CoreML, we need to replace one function call to fastai.layers.Flatten() with torch.nn.Flatten(). This is because fastai's version uses one of CoreML's restricted operators, which would cause the conversion to CoreML to fail.

__all__ = ['create_head', 'create_cnn_model', 'cnn_learner']

create_head[source]

create_head(nf:int, nc:int, lin_ftrs:Optional[Collection[int]]=None, ps:Union[float, Collection[float]]=0.5, concat_pool:bool=True, bn_final:bool=False)

Model head that takes nf features, runs through lin_ftrs, and about nc classes.

create_cnn_model[source]

create_cnn_model(base_arch:Callable, nc:int, cut:Union[int, Callable]=None, pretrained:bool=True, lin_ftrs:Optional[Collection[int]]=None, ps:Union[float, Collection[float]]=0.5, custom_head:Optional[Module]=None, bn_final:bool=False, concat_pool:bool=True)

Create custom convnet architecture

cnn_learner[source]

cnn_learner(data:DataBunch, base_arch:Callable, cut:Union[int, Callable]=None, pretrained:bool=True, lin_ftrs:Optional[Collection[int]]=None, ps:Union[float, Collection[float]]=0.5, custom_head:Optional[Module]=None, split_on:Union[Callable, Collection[Collection[Module]], NoneType]=None, bn_final:bool=False, init='kaiming_normal_', concat_pool:bool=True, **kwargs:Any)
